analysis.Summary: Vue component for handling cryptocurrency deposits: allows users to enter an amount, select a network/token, shows the calculated received token amount, and triggers a deposit action or navigates back.
analysis.Purpose: Provides the UI and logic for the crypto deposit step in the wallet module, including loading configuration, input validation, and event communication with parent components.

Components.name: CryptoDeposit (root)
Components.role: Manages template, state bindings, computed values, and event emissions for the deposit flow.

Components.name: Field
Components.role: Wrapper component providing a styled input field bound to `amount` and hosting the network selector.

Components.name: Select
Components.role: Dropdown component presenting network-token options for the user to choose from.

Functions.name: receiveAmount
Functions.description: Calculates the number of tokens the user will receive by dividing the entered amount by the exchange rate.

Functions.name: depositOptions
Functions.description: Builds an array of network-token option objects from the loaded configuration in the store.

Functions.name: backSelection
Functions.description: Emits a 'back-selection' event to inform the parent to navigate back to the previous menu.

Functions.name: switchMenu
Functions.description: Emits a 'switch-menu' event with a screen index to instruct the parent to switch UI steps.
parameters: screen (Number) — index of the target menu/screen.

Functions.name: onMounted callback
Functions.description: Calls `actions.loadConfig()` on mount to fetch the deposit configuration (networks and tokens).

analysis.Usage: Imported and rendered within the wallet view flow. Parent components listen for 'back-selection' and 'switch-menu' events to manage step navigation in the deposit process.
Notes: Uses BigNumber to avoid floating-point precision issues when calculating received tokens.
Empty scoped `<style>` block—styling relies on imported components and utility classes.
Depends on `state.config` being loaded before rendering inputs (`v-if="state.config"`).
Environment variable TOKEN_EXCHANGE_RATE must be defined for correct receive amount calculation.
Events drive navigation; ensure parent handlers are implemented.
